cold_snaps.status: No active cold snap is observed currently.  The count for this year stands at 6, while the average is around 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwave.status: At present, there is no heatwave.  This year has seen 6 heatwaves; typically, 1.9 heatwaves occur annually.

heaviest_rainfall.status: The storm today is ranked 8th for the amount of rainfall recorded during one storm.  13.04mm fell at a maximum rate of 8.6mm per hour over 7.9 hours.  The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 27.64mm reaching 4.6mm per hour at times.  The event lasted 15.9 hours.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate climaxed at 27.0mm per hour today (ranking first from our records), resulting in 7.99mm of total rain in 2.0 hours.

storm.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 23.2 hours on 23 November 2024 when 24.56mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 6.4mm per hour.
Storm conditions are present now.  It is the first storm in the region since 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: We are in the midst of one of the longest rainy periods recorded.  This rainy period is ranked 5th since records began in August 2024.  The current stretch started on 26 August 2025 and has lasted 9 days.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (200°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 72.13 miles.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.7°C) and outside temperature (up 2.9°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 1.7 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1550 m), light levels (up 3594 lux), and inside temperature (up 2.1°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 41.4m higher than yesterday, 438.3m lower than the past week, 1550.3m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 713m minimum and 1594m maximum, with an average of 1108.3m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1546.7m and 2660m.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; the temperature will feel nicely warm and pleasant. Also, the air will be thick and uncomfortable and winds will be practically absent. Rain showers likely, occasional overcast conditions, and bright intervals likely. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
